meanings.definition: The act or process of compacting or making more dense.
meanings.sent1: The compaction of the soil by the construction workers made it sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The compaction of the trash in the bin allowed for more garbage to fit.
meanings.sent3: The compaction of the snowball was so perfect, it looked like a mini snowman.
meanings.sent4: The compaction of thoughts in his mind felt like a heavy weight pressing down.
meanings.sent5: The compaction of the books on the shelf made them look neat and organized.

meanings.definition: The state of being compacted or made more dense.
meanings.sent1: The compaction of the soil resulted in a firm foundation for the building.
meanings.sent2: The compaction of the clothes in the suitcase saved space for more items.
meanings.sent3: The compaction of the crowd at the concert made it hard to move around.
meanings.sent4: The compaction of emotions in her heart felt like a pressure cooker about to explode.
meanings.sent5: The compaction of the ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious outcome.
